column4: By default, the installer will give you the option to install Ubuntu side by side with whatever operating system is currently on your computer. You can choose that if you want to set up a dual-boot,   i dont get that option when i goto install
shouldnt i shrink my hard drive in half first?
ok ill be back ill get back on when i log back in
it depends on the type of installation you choose
in the beginning, the installer will ask you to choose an installation type, how are you gonna install ? Via wubi ?
ya but are you installing it from within windows or right frmo system boot up ?
you will have very nice pics to illustrate the installation process here http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/installing
you mean that you dont see " Install them side by side" option ???
oops, ok ! reboot your sytem again and again boot your system from CD and in the UBuntu menu, select  "Check CD for defects "
which CD your have ? 8.10 or 9.04 or 9.10 ?
ok did you download it or did you get it from Canonical directly by post ?
ok reboot and check it as i said before
no need, we are just checking the CD for defects now. Lets worry about installation and space later !
